intro: Peucedanum dissolutum, commonly known as the slender cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia and parts of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Peucedanum dissolutum is not typically cultivated for its edible qualities but is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological habitat.
